item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 6, 2025 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Rsync replaced with openrsync on macOS Sequoia (41 points | 28 comments)
2. Standard Ebooks: liberated ebooks, carefully produced for the true book lover (886 points | 180 comments)
3. The "S" in MCP Stands for Security (481 points | 121 comments)

7. Pitfalls of Safe Rust (106 points | 68 comments)
8. Charging electric vehicles 5x faster in subfreezing temps (29 points | 8 comments)
9. Microcomputers – The First Wave: Responding to Altair (6 points | discuss)
10. Neutron Stars Hint at Another Dimension (111 points | 43 comments)
11. Gumroad's Interestingly Timed "Open-Source" Play (158 points | 60 comments)
12. Max severity RCE flaw discovered in widely used Apache Parquet (111 points | 49 comments)

14. Show HN: I built a Rust crate for running unsafe code safely (89 points | 48 comments)
15. Foundry (YC F24) Is Hiring ( | hide)

20. Blacksmithing and Lisp (125 points | 57 comments)
21. 'Minecraft Movie' Leaks Online: Full Unfinished Version Shared (29 points | 22 comments)
22. Lessons from open source in the Mexican government (258 points | 73 comments)
23. The order of files in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.d/ matters (219 points | 103 comments)
24. Thomas Rattigan, short-lived Commodore CEO (42 points | 12 comments)
25. My Browser WASM't Prepared for This. Using DuckDB, Apache Arrow and Web Workers (95 points | 20 comments)
26. Show HN: LocalScore – Local LLM Benchmark (72 points | 6 comments)
27. What if we made advertising illegal? (1670 points | 1214 comments)
28. MonkeysPaw – a prompt-driven web framework in Ruby (23 points | 6 comments)
29. Show HN: I built a word game. My mom thinks it's great. What do you think? (461 points | 238 comments)
30. Federal cuts disrupt repairs to iconic U.S. trails (130 points | 107 comments)
